documents: football fans, get ready to rock. while there’s no telling which two teams will face off when super bowl liii hits atlanta on february 3, a source tells us that maroon 5 have been tapped to grace the halftime stage. newline_char newline_char “the offer has been extended and they’ve pretty much accepted,” says the insider in the latest issue of us weekly. it’s a dream come true for adam levine and his six bandmates. as the voice coach told howard stern in 2015, “we very actively want to play the super bowl.” newline_char newline_char though at the time the 39-year-old frontman denied rumors that the group was in talks to play the big game that year, he also told stern they had been on a “short list” of groups for a while. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char currently on tour promoting their 2017 album, red pill blues, the band has a break from shows in between a las vegas new year’s eve gig and the february 19 start of the australian leg of their tour — leaving their schedules wide open for the february 3 game. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char before embarking on the tour in may, levine opened up to ellen degeneres about bringing his wife, behati prinsloo, and daughters dusty rose, 23 months, and gio grace, 7 months, on the road with him for the first time. “we’ll probably have to have a family bus,” he told the talk show host. “touring with the kids will be fun because it will be an amazing experience for them. they get to see the world.” newline_char newline_char at last year’s super bowl in minneapolis, minnesota, justin timberlake took the stage to deliver a medley of his hits and a tribute to the late singer prince. newline_char newline_char for more on maroon 5 and super bowl liii, pick up the new issue of us weekly, on stands now. newline_char newline_char reporting by jennifer peros newline_char newline_char sign up now for the us weekly newsletter to get breaking celebrity news, hot pics and more delivered straight to your inbox! newline_char newline_char want stories like these delivered straight to your phone? download the us weekly iphone app now!

looks like it's not a "secret" anymore! newline_char newline_char a source close to the situation says maroon 5 is scheduled to perform super bowl liii halftime on feb 3rd in atlanta, georgia. newline_char newline_char a second source close to the nfl tells et that maroon 5 is the halftime performer for super bowl liii. newline_char newline_char the band -- made up of frontman adam levine with jesse carmichael, james valentine, pj morton, matt flynn, sam farrar and mickey madden -- is currently on their red pill bluestour, but conveniently have a break between a new year's eve show in las vegas and the australian leg of their tour, which kicks off on feb. 19. newline_char newline_char levine has previously expressed interest in performing the halftime show, telling howard stern in 2015 that he and his bandmates "very actively want to play the super bowl." newline_char newline_char a spokesperson for the nfl released a statement to et regarding who is being considered to perform on super bowl sunday. "it’s a super bowl tradition to speculate about the performers for the pepsi halftime show," the statement begins. "we are continuing to work with pepsi on our plans, but do not have any announcements to make on what will be another epic show." newline_char newline_char et has reached out to the band's reps, as well as pepsi, who sponsors the halftime show. newline_char newline_char last year at the u.s. bank stadium in minneapolis, minnesota, justin timberlake did the honors of performing at halftime during the super bowl lii game, which the philadelphia eagles won 41-33 over the new england patriots. newline_char newline_char see highlights from his show, which included a tribute to prince, below: newline_char newline_char related content: newline_char newline_char kelly clarkson fans petition she headline super bowl halftime show after slaying us open performance newline_char newline_char tom brady and gisele bundchen have pda-packed sunday one week after super bowl loss newline_char newline_char justin timberlake nearly brings super bowl 'selfie kid' to tears during 'ellen' surprise newline_char newline_char related gallery

maroon 5 will be the halftime performers at the 2019 super bowl, multiple sources confirm to variety. newline_char newline_char while the group is stylistically more similar to recent performers like justin timberlake and bruno mars than more controversial ones such as beyonce and lady gaga, maroon 5’s most recent hit was a tag-team with cardi b — “girls like you” — and it recently collaborated with kendrick lamar on the song “don’t wanna know,” so some left-field guest appearances on super bowl sunday are certainly a possibility. newline_char newline_char one of the great challenges in choosing a halftime performer isn’t just its mainstream appeal, but in finding an artist who hasn’t already performed. over the years, bruce springsteen, paul mccartney, u2, the who, katy perry and even the black eyed peas have all performed, and of course the 2004 set from janet jackson (featuring timberlake) was marred by controversy due to her “wardrobe malfunction.” prince’s 2007 performance — which saw him playing a galvanizing version of “purple rain” in a rainstorm — is widely regarded as the all-time best halftime set. newline_char newline_char the nfl has faced an additional challenge this year due to its stance regarding former san francisco 49ers quarterback colin kaepernick’s decision to take a knee during the national anthem as a sign of protest, which has spurred outrage in some quarters, from the president on down. kaepernick has not played since the 2016 season and his contract has not been picked up by another team, largely due to the controversy. reports emerged last year that jay-z had turned down an offer to perform during halftime, which he seemingly confirmed in the lyrics to his recent song with beyonce, “apesh–“: “i said no to the super bowl: you need me, i don’t need you.” newline_char newline_char reached for comment, a nfl rep tells variety, “it’s a super bowl tradition to speculate about the performers for the pepsi halftime show. we are continuing to work with [longtime sponsor] pepsi on our plans but do not have any announcements to make on what will be another epic show.” newline_char newline_char a rep for maroon 5 could not immediately be reached for comment.

summary: – according to multiple sources, maroon 5 will be the halftime performers at the 2019 super bowl. the group is stylistically more similar to recent performers like justin timberlake and bruno mars than more controversial ones such as beyonce and lady gaga. however, maroon 5’s most recent hit was a tag-team with cardi b — “girls like you” — and it recently collaborated with kendrick lamar on the song “don’t wanna know,” so some left-field guest appearances on super bowl sunday are certainly a possibility. a great challenge in choosing a halftime performer is finding an artist who hasn’t already performed. over the years, bruce springsteen, paul mccartney, u2, the who, katy perry and even the black eyed peas have all performed, and of course the 2004 set from janet jackson (featuring timberlake) was marred by controversy due to her “wardrobe malfunction.” prince’s 2007 performance — which saw him playing a galvanizing version of “purple rain” in a rainstorm — is widely regarded as the all-time best halftime set. the nfl has

summary: – who gets to play the halftime show at super bowl liii? well, guess who's going to be playing for the home team? maroon 5 have been in talks to perform at the big game since 2015, abc news reports. "the offer has been extended and they've pretty much accepted," a source tells us weekly. as for who the band will be playing, the answer to that question is probably going to be revealed in the next issue of us weekly, on stands now.

justin timberlake and bruno mars than more controversial ones such as beyonce and lady gaga, maroon 5’s most recent hit was a tag-team with cardi b — “girls like you” — and it recently collaborated with kendrick lamar on the song “don’t wanna know,” so some left-field guest appearances on super bowl sunday are certainly a possibility. newline_char newline_char one of the great challenges in choosing a halftime performer isn’t just its mainstream appeal, but in finding an artist who hasn’t already performed. over the years, bruce springsteen, paul mccartney, u2, the who, katy perry and even the black eyed peas have all performed, and of course the 2004 set from janet jackson (featuring timberlake) was marred by controversy due to her “wardrobe malfunction.” prince’s 2007 performance — which saw him playing a galvanizing version of “purple rain” in a rainstorm — is widely regarded as the all-time best halftime set. newline_char newline_char the nfl has faced an additional challenge this year due to its stance regarding former san francisco 49ers quarterback colin kaepernick’s decision to take a knee during the national anthem as a sign of protest, which has spurred outrage in some quarters, from the president on down. kaepernick has not played since the 2016 season and his contract has not been picked up by another team, largely due to the controversy. reports emerged last year that jay-z had turned down an offer to perform during halftime, which he seemingly confirmed in the lyrics to his recent song with beyonce, “apesh–“: “i said no to the super bowl: you need me, i don’t need you.” newline_char newline_char reached for comment, a nfl rep tells variety, “it’s a super bowl tradition to speculate about the performers for the pepsi halftime show. we are continuing to work with [longtime sponsor] pepsi on our plans but do not have any announcements to make on what will be another epic show.” newline_char newline_char a rep for maroon 5 could not immediately be reached for comment.

summary: – looks like maroon 5 will perform at super bowl liii in atlanta next week. multiple sources tell us weekly that the band has been asked to perform. "the offer has been extended and they’ve pretty much accepted," a source tells et. a spokesperson for pepsi has reached out to the band's reps, who are currently working on plans for the show. back in 2015, levine told howard stern that he and his bandmates "very actively want to play the super bowl" and had been on a "short list" of performers for a while. the band is currently on tour promoting its 2017 album, red pill blues, and will perform a las vegas new year's eve gig and the australian leg of their tour beginning feb. 19. when asked about the potential performance, levine told ellen degeneres that he and his kids would be on the road for the first time with him. "we’ll probably have to have a family bus," he said. "touring with the kids will be fun because it will be an amazing experience for them. they get to see the world." a spokesperson for the nfl has yet to comment on maroon 5's planned performance, but says it's a "super bowl tradition" to speculate about the performers for the pepsi halftime show.

documents: image copyright ap image caption defections across the north-south land border are rare newline_char newline_char a north korean soldier has defected to the south across the two countries' heavily armed border, south korean officials have said. newline_char newline_char the soldier said he shot dead two officers before crossing over just after noon (03:00 gmt) on saturday. newline_char newline_char our correspondent says defections across the land border are rare. the last soldier fled in 2010. newline_char newline_char more than 20,000 north koreans have gone to the south in the last 60 years, mostly via china and se asia. newline_char newline_char the two countries are still technically at war after the 1950-53 conflict, which ended in a ceasefire not a peace treaty. newline_char newline_char gunshots heard newline_char newline_char the soldier was quoted as saying that he killed his platoon and squad commanders while on guard duty. newline_char newline_char a defence ministry official said six gunshots were heard and guards saw the soldier cross the demarcation line on a western section of the tightly guarded border. newline_char newline_char they used loudspeakers to establish that he wanted to defect and guide him to safety, they added. newline_char newline_char the official said he was in protective custody and was still being interrogated. newline_char newline_char there has been no confirmation of the north korean casualties and no unusual activity observed on the north korean side of the border. newline_char newline_char the bbc's lucy williamson in seoul says that about a million soldiers and a million land mines line the demilitarised zone, and only a handful of people have crossed from north to south by land in the past few years. newline_char newline_char most make their way to the south by a long and dangerous land route, she says. newline_char newline_char this takes them through china and on to countries such as thailand or mongolia.

in what is apparently the first such incident in nearly two-and-half years, a north korean soldier has defected across the heavily armed land border with the south. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char south korean military officials say a soldier from the north claims he shot and killed his platoon and squad chiefs while on guard duty before defecting across the heavily fortified demilitarized zone. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char the incident occurred at noon saturday along the western section of the dmz. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char officials say south korean troops at the border heard gunshots, confirmed the north korean soldier's desire to defect, and escorted him to a guard post. he is now undergoing interrogation. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char the senior analyst in seoul for the international crisis group, daniel pinkston, says there is no indication the defection denotes any instability in the reclusive and impoverished state. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char “we'll see as he's debriefed and it's just a one-off incident, so i don't think there's too much we can read into it besides that at this point,” he said. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char pinkston points out that soldiers in north korea's army posted to the border area are scrupulously vetted. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char “those who are stationed in the border area, around the dmz and especially right on the dmz, are those who are considered to be loyal to the regime. they've been screened and they do not put people there who would be considered disloyal,” he said. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char defections by north koreans along the dmz are rare. the last known incident involving a soldier occurred in march, 2010. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char under north korea's collective punishment system, a disloyal act of this magnitude would mean harsh treatment for the soldier's family, extending for three generations. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char the joint chiefs of staff in seoul says south korea has increased surveillance along the dmz following the incident and the military has activated its crisis management facility. however, there is no sign of any unusual activity on the northern side. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char the dmz is a legacy of the 1953 armistice which brought a three-year civil war to a halt. but the two koreas have never signed a peace treaty.

summary: A North Korean soldier has defected to the South across the two countries' heavily armed border, South Korean officials have said. The soldier said he shot dead two officers before crossing over just after noon (03:00 GMT) on Saturday. Our correspondent says defections across the land border are rare. The last soldier fled in 2010. More than 20,000 North Koreans have gone to the South in the last 60 years, mostly via China and SE Asia. The two countries are still technically at war after the 1950-53 conflict, which ended in a ceasefire not a peace treaty.

summary: – a north korean soldier has defected to the south across the heavily armed border, south korean officials say. the soldier shot and killed his platoon and squad commanders before crossing over just after noon today, the ap reports. the defection is the first such incident in nearly two-and-a-half years, the bbc notes. generally, soldiers defect to the south by crossing over the heavily fortified demilitarized zone, or DMZ, and then making their way to countries such as china or mongolia. the last such incident occurred in 2010, the wire service notes.

summary: – one north korean soldier yesterday defected to the south, according to south korean officials. the soldier reportedly shot dead two officers before crossing the demarcation line, reports the bbc. officials say guards saw the soldier cross the line on a western section of the tightly guarded border. they used loudspeakers to establish that he wanted to defect and guide him to safety. there has been no confirmation of the north korean casualties. south korean troops at the border heard gunshots, confirmed the north korean soldier's desire to defect, and escorted him to a guard post where he is undergoing interrogation. an analyst in seoul for the international crisis group, daniel pinkston, says there is no indication the defection denotes any instability in the reclusive and impoverished state. “we'll see as he's debriefed and it's just a one-off incident, so i don't think there's too much we can read into it besides that at this point,” he tells the washington post. defections by north koreans along the dmz are rare. the last known incident occurred in march, 2010. under north korea's collective punishment system, a disloyal act of this magnitude would mean harsh treatment for the soldier's family, extending for three generations.

documents: it is illegal to take conch shells with living organisms from florida beaches. (photo: breckeni, getty images/istockphoto) newline_char newline_char a texas tourist who collected 40 queen conchs seashells from key west, florida, is going to jail for 15 days. newline_char newline_char a florida judge also sentenced diana fiscal-gonzalez of dallas to serve six months of probation and pay a $500 fine, plus $268 for court costs, for taking 40 queen conchs from the waters that surround key west, the miami herald reports. newline_char newline_char fiscal-gonzalez, who pleaded guilty, said she didn't know taking the shells from the beach was illegal. she was planning to give the state-protected mollusks away as gifts. newline_char newline_char recreational collection of empty seashells is allowed in florida, but the conch shells fiscal-gonzalez collected contained organisms inside. taking a living queen conch is illegal. also, killing, mutilating or removing a living queen conch from a shell is prohibited, the florida fish and wildlife conservation commission notes. newline_char newline_char more: florida bucket list: 20 things you have to do in the sunshine state newline_char newline_char fiscal-gonzalez was arrested by an officer from the commission on july 13, 2017, after an anonymous tipster called the agency. officer john martino reported seeing three containers full of queen conches soaking in bleach and water when he met with fiscal-gonzalez. newline_char newline_char conch shells are an important part of florida keys culture. native-born islanders are called conchs, and the keys are nicknamed the conch republic. empty conch shells, which produce a unique sound when blown, have also been used as signaling devices in the florida keys for centuries. newline_char newline_char follow ashley may on twitter: @ashleymaytweets newline_char newline_char read or share this story: https://usat.ly/2uwcufe
she said she didn’t know it was illegal to take conchs. she’s heading to jail anyway.

summary: – a texas tourist who collected 40 queen conchs seashells from key west, florida, is going to jail for 15 days. diana fiscal-gonzalez pleaded guilty to taking the shells, reports the miami herald. she was sentenced to six months of probation and pay a $500 fine, plus $268 for court costs. fiscal-gonzalez says she didn't know taking the shells from the beach was illegal. she was planning to give the state-protected mollusks away as gifts. recreational collection of empty seashells is allowed in florida, but the conch shells fiscal-gonzalez collected contained organisms inside. taking a living queen conch is illegal, the florida fish and wildlife conservation commission notes. killing, mutilating or removing a living queen conch from a shell is prohibited. an officer at the florida fish and wildlife commission reported seeing three containers full of queen conches soaking in bleach and water when he met with fiscal-gonzalez. (the mollusks are important in the florida keys, where native-born islanders are called conchs, and the keys are nicknamed the conch republic.) click for her full story.

documents: san francisco (marketwatch) -- trading in all nasdaq-listed stocks and options was halted on thursday due to technical problems on the bourse, according to nasdaq omx group (nasdaq:ndaq) . the exchange sent out a series of emails alerting investors that it was experiencing issues with "quote submissions." in response, the new york stock exchange has also stopped trading in all nasdaq securities at the request of nasdaq omx. "all orders in those securities have been cancelled back to customers," said nyse in a statement. the nasdaq composite index (nasdaq:comp) was last at 3631.17, up 31.38 points, before trading was suspended. there was no immediate word on when transactions will resume. [updated with nyse developments.] newline_char newline_char read the full story: newline_char newline_char nasdaq halts all trade in nasdaq-listed securities newline_char newline_char u.s. stocks up; nasdaq-listed trade halted

summary: – Trading in all Nasdaq-listed stocks and options was halted on Thursday due to technical problems on the bourse, according to Nasdaq OMX Group. The exchange sent out a series of emails alerting investors that it was experiencing issues with "quote submissions." In response, the New York Stock Exchange has also stopped trading in all Nasdaq securities at the request of Nasdaq OMX. The Nasdaq Composite Index was last at 3631.17, up 31.38 points, before trading was suspended. There was no immediate word on when transactions will resume.

summary: – a technical glitch knocked out trading in all nasdaq stock market securities for three hours thursday afternoon, an unprecedented meltdown for a u.s. exchange that paralyzed a broad swath of markets and highlighted the fragility of the financial world's electronic backbone. "the decision to reopen trading with about 35 minutes to go before the close came after exchange officials were sure that banks ... . . . it came after a large number of traders raised questions about the reliability of the nasdaq trading system," says a trader at new york stock exchange. "all orders in those securities have been cancelled back to customers," it added. the nasdaq composite index climbed 31.38 points to 3631.17 before trading was suspended. there was no immediate word on when transactions will resume. summary: This document is a summary of the episode "Cartoon Wars Part I" from the television show "South Park". In the episode, Cartman and Kyle are at war over the popular cartoon, "Family Guy". When the creators of the show announce that they will show the image of the prophet Muhammad, the network threatens to ban the episode. Cartman sees this as his chance to get "Family Guy" off the air for good. The two boys embark upon a mad chase across the country and the fate of "Family Guy" lies with whichever boy reaches Hollywood first.

summary: – "family guy" is still on the air, but the network has decided to ban the image of prophet muhammad. according to cartoon wars, the network plans to pull the cartoon from the air if it doesn't contain the image of cartman and kyle, who are currently on a mad chase across the country for the life of the boy. if the network doesn't show the image, cartman and kyle will have a chance to pull the cartoon off the air for good. meanwhile, alexa internet has been donating the crawl data of family guy's images to the wayback machine since an embargo period. the archive shows that these data have been added to the wayback machine since april 1996. | read the full story of cartoon wars in full at the new york times. summary: – first ronald reagan, then arnold schwarzenegger, and now … susan rice! those 94 words are "the talking points," writes james sherman at the washington post. they were used by united nations ambassador susan rice on sunday talk shows, where she mused that the attack had taken place without evidence of al qaeda. it's now clear that the 94 words were edited so as to avoid mentioning al qaeda. "that moment has become a proxy for a," writes sherman. "the intelligence summary emerged from a daylong email debate between more than two dozen intelligence officials, in which they contested and whittled the available evidence into a bland summary with no reference to al qaeda." the administration now acknowledges that the missing evidence is what rice calls "the talking points," and that it has been edited to make it appear as though there was no al qaeda connection in the summary. (an earlier version of this piece referred to it as "the talking points." that's what rice said on the same show.) click for her full column, or to read her full interview with sherman. (here's rice's take on the situation in benghazi. scroll for more uplifting passages.)

documents: huntington beach – two young men found dead from gunshot wounds in a huntington beach apartment on sunday, nov. 19 have been identified as brothers, with investigators not ruling out a murder-suicide or an accident-suicide, police said on monday. newline_char newline_char officers found benjamin ullestad, 25, and brandon ullestad, 22, dead in the apartment they shared just before 3 p.m., according to the orange county coroner’s office. newline_char newline_char investigators are trying to piece together what led to the deaths, said officer angela bennett, an agency spokeswoman. newline_char newline_char “we don’t know,” she said. “we’re not ruling (murder-suicide) out. we’re not ruling out an accident-suicide. but we are not looking for any outstanding suspects.” newline_char newline_char though police would not give many details about the investigation yet, they did say a handgun was found at the scene. newline_char newline_char it was unclear who made the distressed call from inside the home that led police to the apartment, which is close to marina high school, the baseball fields of marina park and helen murphy branch library.
a man who declined to give his name but identified himself as the owner of the building wore surgical gloves as he loaded full trash bags into the back of an suv.

huntington beach (cbsla) – the shooting deaths of two brothers inside a huntington beach apartment were being investigated tuesday as the result of a possible murder-suicide, authorities said. newline_char newline_char police received a call at 2:45 p.m. sunday that sent officers to the 15700 block of taft lane, said huntington beach police lt. david dereszynski. they found the bodies of two men identified by the county coroner’s office as 25-year-old benjamin ullestad and 22-year-old brandon ullestad, he said. a handgun was recovered at the scene. newline_char newline_char investigators were not ruling out that the double shooting could be a case of murder-suicide, police said. newline_char newline_char “we are not looking for outstanding suspects at this time,” dereszynski said, adding that “there is no threat to the community.” newline_char newline_char (©2017 cbs local media, a division of cbs radio inc. all rights reserved. this material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. wire services contributed to this report.)

summary: – police in huntington beach, orange county, are investigating the shooting deaths of two brothers as a possible murder-suicide, cbs los angeles reports. officers found the bodies of benjamin ullestad, 25, and brandon ullestad, 22, just before 3 p.m. sunday in the apartment they shared in the 15700 block of taft lane, near marina high school, the baseball fields of marina park, and the helen murphy branch library, police said. they say a handgun was recovered at the scene. “we are not looking for any outstanding suspects at this time,” said huntington beach police lt. david dereszynski. “there is no threat to the community.” the orange county coroner's office has identified the men as benjamin ullestad and brandon ullestad. both were from utah and lived in huntington beach, cbs los angeles reports. a man who declined to give his name but identified himself as the owner of the building wore surgical gloves as he loaded trash bags into the back of an suv.

documents: the 2012 republican primary is about to enter the elimination round. newline_char newline_char when the gop presidential candidates meet in michigan wednesday for a cnbc debate on the economy, they’ll no longer be looking to make a first impression. with less than two months to go before the iowa caucuses, there’s a much more urgent objective: survival. newline_char newline_char text size - newline_char newline_char + newline_char newline_char reset allen on gop debates politico 44 newline_char newline_char herman cain may not be viable much longer, unless he can manage to move the 2012 conversation away from the allegations of sexual harassment that have plagued his campaign. flagging conservatives such as rick perry and michele bachmann can’t afford to muddle aimlessly through another candidate forum. if newt gingrich and rick santorum can’t take advantage of this chaotic moment, they may never get another chance. and jon huntsman is running out of time to connect with his attempt at a maverick message. newline_char newline_char with the exception of front-runner mitt romney — and perhaps ron paul, the libertarian congressman whose devoted base of support never really diminishes or grows — nearly every candidate in the race is almost one misstep away from political death. newline_char newline_char “voters have formed general impressions of most of the candidates by this point, but a mixed or poor impression hasn’t been fatal,” said dan schnur, a former adviser to john mccain’s 2000 campaign. “going forward, any problems become much more damaging because the clock is ticking.” newline_char newline_char schnur, who now directs the university of southern california’s unruh institute of politics, said cain had helped speed up the winnowing process: “we were probably going to get to this point pretty soon anyway, but the controversy surrounding cain’s campaign may be serving as a reminder to voters of the stakes involved here.” newline_char newline_char michigan republican national committeeman saul anuzis, a romney supporter, suggested debates were increasingly about “which people make the mistakes and have the most to lose, not the most to gain.” newline_char newline_char “usually there’s a loser in a debate, not necessarily a winner,” said anuzis. “i think there will be a desire by all the candidates to stay on [economic] issues and focus on those issues. the question is whether we will get pulled away by the cain stuff or something else.” newline_char newline_char cain signaled in a press conference tuesday that he hopes to move on from battling charges of personal misconduct and get back to talking about policy. with his poll numbers holding up in the low-20 percent range, it’s clear that some of his fans have been giving him the benefit of the doubt so far. newline_char newline_char the cnbc debate – the ninth of the year, and the sixth involving the full gop presidential field – will test cain’s ability to hold on to those supporters and turn the page on the worst week of his campaign.

article newline_char newline_char the cnbc debate kicks off tonight in the shadow of the cain circus. will the other candidates ignore the elephant in the room, and will gingrich finally reach the top tier? david a. graham on what to look for. plus join howard kurtz for a live chat during the debate, starting at 8pm et. newline_char newline_char after three weeks’ respite, the packed republican presidential debate season is about to return to full tilt. the gop field will convene in a detroit suburb on wednesday for a debate hosted by cnbc. using a traditional setup, the debate is supposed to focus on economic issues, including taxation, jobs, and the deficit, but fireworks are likely on a few other topics as well. here’s what to watch for wednesday night. newline_char newline_char 1. will the herman cain allegations take center stage? newline_char newline_char last time around, herman cain was a target because his fortunes were rising, along with the popularity of his 9-9-9 plan. much has happened since, and although his polls numbers have flat-lined, not tanked, repeated allegations of sexual harassment or worse seem to be on their way to derailing the cain train. how will his rivals handle it? they could attack him directly; even the usually detached romney edged that way tuesday, saying the allegations against cain were serious. but that might be unnecessary and counterproductive. focusing on cain’s circus rather than, say, high unemployment is bad for the republican brand, so they may instead let him bleed slowly as they avert their eyes. newline_char newline_char 2. will the ‘not-mitt’ movement dent romney’s armor? newline_char newline_char although it’s long been clear that mitt romney was the man to beat in the republican field, the last two weeks have seen the anybody-but-mitt movement crystallizing like never before. bookended by scathing attacks by george will and erick erickson—the voices of the old republican establishment and the upstart activist right, respectively—and peaking with the creation of the website not mitt romney, the former massachusetts governor’s opponents have come together, transformers-style. but behind whom? with most of the rest of the field fading or too damaged to take up the standard, jon huntsman jr., whose once-promising candidacy hasn’t even gotten as far as spinning its wheels, is making a late play, producing his own anti-romney ad. can huntsman or some other challenger dent romney’s armor? or will the unflappable frontrunner parry all blows with the effortless, bland approach he’s used so far? newline_char newline_char 3. will newt gingrich finally join the first tier? newline_char newline_char with cain potentially on the outs, could newt gingrich finally be having his moment? the former house speaker could appeal to the same voters as cain (they agree on plenty, as demonstrated by their lovefest on saturday), he’s experienced, and his campaign seems to have come back from several prematurely declared deaths. indeed, he’s rising in some polls. but gingrich’s previous debate performances have been polarizing. while some of the more cerebral republican pundits gushed over his oratorical and rhetorical talents, he has a tendency to come across as petulantly contrarian and needlessly pedantic. if he can temper those tendencies, the debate could propel him to the first tier of the race. newline_char newline_char 4. will rick perry and michele bachmann show up? newline_char newline_char long, long ago—if you can remember that far back—both michele bachmann and rick perry were first-tier candidates. their chances at returning to the top tier are slipping away quickly, though perry’s ample war chest is a crutch. it will be interesting to see how they try to claw back—if at all. will perry come across as giddy and drunk, as he did in new hampshire last month? will bachmann figuratively show up? she has been a nonfactor for several debates, but could try to expand on outreach to moms or maybe go big on religion. newline_char newline_char 5. will serious economic plans finally make an appearance?

summary: The 2012 Republican primary is entering the elimination round, and the candidates are under pressure to make a good impression. With less than two months to go before the Iowa caucuses, the goal is now to simply survive. Almost every candidate is one misstep away from political death. The upcoming debate will test Herman Cain's ability to move on from the sexual harassment allegations against him. There is also the question of whether or not Mitt Romney's opponents will be able to dent his armor. Finally, it remains to be seen if any of the candidates will be able to present a serious economic plan.

summary: – the gop candidates are in for a rude awakening tonight, writes politico's anderson cooper, as they prepare for a primetime debate in michigan that could be the last chance for embattled candidate herman cain to make a comeback. "he's going to have to answer a barrage of questions about his record of sexual harassment and assault, and if he doesn't, he's going to be out of the race," cooper says. other takeaways from politico's anderson: "most of the candidates are going to be looking at cain like a lost cause," says dan schnur, a former adviser to john mccain's 2000 campaign. "if he doesn't get on the stage and answer the questions, it's going to be a long night." but cain could get a tiny bit of a break, notes the new york times. last night's debate, he predicts, "is going to be all about cain." the headline of cnbc's pre-debate piece in the washington post sums up the sentiment: "the circus is on." with less than two months to go before the iowa caucuses, the gop candidates are in a race of survival, writes politico's anderson. "if cain can't get on the stage and answer the tough questions, he's out of the race. gingrich and santorum can't afford to muddle aimlessly through another candidate forum."

david a. graham on what to look for. plus join howard kurtz for a live chat during the debate, starting at 8pm et. newline_char newline_char after three weeks’ respite, the packed republican presidential debate season is about to return to full tilt. the gop field will convene in a detroit suburb on wednesday for a debate hosted by cnbc. using a traditional setup, the debate is supposed to focus on economic issues, including taxation, jobs, and the deficit, but fireworks are likely on a few other topics as well. here’s what to watch for wednesday night. newline_char newline_char 1. will the herman cain allegations take center stage? newline_char newline_char last time around, herman cain was a target because his fortunes were rising, along with the popularity of his 9-9-9 plan. much has happened since, and although his polls numbers have flat-lined, not tanked, repeated allegations of sexual harassment or worse seem to be on their way to derailing the cain train. how will his rivals handle it? they could attack him directly; even the usually detached romney edged that way tuesday, saying the allegations against cain were serious. but that might be unnecessary and counterproductive. focusing on cain’s circus rather than, say, high unemployment is bad for the republican brand, so they may instead let him bleed slowly as they avert their eyes. newline_char newline_char 2. will the ‘not-mitt’ movement dent romney’s armor? newline_char newline_char although it’s long been clear that mitt romney was the man to beat in the republican field, the last two weeks have seen the anybody-but-mitt movement crystallizing like never before. bookended by scathing attacks by george will and erick erickson—the voices of the old republican establishment and the upstart activist right, respectively—and peaking with the creation of the website not mitt romney, the former massachusetts governor’s opponents have come together, transformers-style. but behind whom? with most of the rest of the field fading or too damaged to take up the standard, jon huntsman jr., whose once-promising candidacy hasn’t even gotten as far as spinning its wheels, is making a late play, producing his own anti-romney ad. can huntsman or some other challenger dent romney’s armor? or will the unflappable frontrunner parry all blows with the effortless, bland approach he’s used so far? newline_char newline_char 3. will newt gingrich finally join the first tier? newline_char newline_char with cain potentially on the outs, could newt gingrich finally be having his moment? the former house speaker could appeal to the same voters as cain (they agree on plenty, as demonstrated by their lovefest on saturday), he’s experienced, and his campaign seems to have come back from several prematurely declared deaths. indeed, he’s rising in some polls. but gingrich’s previous debate performances have been polarizing. while some of the more cerebral republican pundits gushed over his oratorical and rhetorical talents, he has a tendency to come across as petulantly contrarian and needlessly pedantic. if he can temper those tendencies, the debate could propel him to the first tier of the race. newline_char newline_char 4. will rick perry and michele bachmann show up? newline_char newline_char long, long ago—if you can remember that far back—both michele bachmann and rick perry were first-tier candidates. their chances at returning to the top tier are slipping away quickly, though perry’s ample war chest is a crutch. it will be interesting to see how they try to claw back—if at all. will perry come across as giddy and drunk, as he did in new hampshire last month? will bachmann figuratively show up? she has been a nonfactor for several debates, but could try to expand on outreach to moms or maybe go big on religion. newline_char newline_char 5. will serious economic plans finally make an appearance?
document: the 2012 republican primary is about to enter the elimination round. newline_char newline_char when the gop presidential candidates meet in michigan wednesday for a cnbc debate on the economy, they’ll no longer be looking to make a first impression. with less than two months to go before the iowa caucuses, there’s a much more urgent objective: survival. newline_char newline_char text size - newline_char newline_char + newline_char newline_char reset allen on gop debates politico 44 newline_char newline_char herman cain may not be viable much longer, unless he can manage to move the 2012 conversation away from the allegations of sexual harassment that have plagued his campaign. flagging conservatives such as rick perry and michele bachmann can’t afford to muddle aimlessly through another candidate forum. if newt gingrich and rick santorum can’t take advantage of this chaotic moment, they may never get another chance. and jon huntsman is running out of time to connect with his attempt at a maverick message. newline_char newline_char with the exception of front-runner mitt romney — and perhaps ron paul, the libertarian congressman whose devoted base of support never really diminishes or grows — nearly every candidate in the race is almost one misstep away from political death. newline_char newline_char “voters have formed general impressions of most of the candidates by this point, but a mixed or poor impression hasn’t been fatal,” said dan schnur, a former adviser to john mccain’s 2000 campaign. “going forward, any problems become much more damaging because the clock is ticking.” newline_char newline_char schnur, who now directs the university of southern california’s unruh institute of politics, said cain had helped speed up the winnowing process: “we were probably going to get to this point pretty soon anyway, but the controversy surrounding cain’s campaign may be serving as a reminder to voters of the stakes involved here.” newline_char newline_char michigan republican national committeeman saul anuzis, a romney supporter, suggested debates were increasingly about “which people make the mistakes and have the most to documents: the second ex-wife of peter cook has issued a written apology to his first wife — supermodel christie brinkley — for ignoring her warning about the architect’s philandering. newline_char newline_char “christie and i have talked recently and i have privately apologized to her, but, given the public nature of their divorce and custody battle, i feel a public apology is also appropriate and deserved,” suzanne shaw wrote in a letter obtained by the post thursday. newline_char newline_char shaw said she was sorry for bad-mouthing the model by saying in 2012 that “it was the black cloud of christie brinkley’s hate” that had tainted shaw’s marriage to cook — when he had actually been continuing his skirt-chasing ways. newline_char newline_char “christie was wrongly vilified as being an embittered ex-wife,” shaw wrote. “i now believe she had every right to do what she did by taking a public stand; she was only trying to protect her children and have the truth be told. given the nature of peter’s behavior, and battles for sole custody of their children, it was necessary for her to confront him publicly.” newline_char newline_char christie’s six-year marriage to cook imploded in 2007 after she learned of his affair with 18-year-old office clerk diana bianchi. cook rebounded by getting hitched to shaw, who stood by his side during his ongoing court battles with brink­­ley. during a 2012 hearing, brinkley tried to warn shaw about cook’s infidelity. newline_char newline_char “when you find out he’s been cheating on you, i’ll be here for you,” brink­ley said in a courthouse hallway. newline_char newline_char “come up with a new line!” shaw barked back. it turned out brink­ley was right, and shaw split with cook this year, accusing him of cheating. newline_char newline_char “what i say here is by my own volition. i truly feel it’s simply the right thing to do. i’m deeply sorry for my part in causing christie any unnecessary pain,” shaw writes. newline_char newline_char “unfortunately, i fell under peter’s spell, but now that the reality of who he is has been revealed, i regret my involvement. christie is a wonderful mother and community member who involves herself in charitable causes and has truly made a contribution to society.” newline_char newline_char “last week, christie said, ‘i wish you the courage to do the right thing for yourself, your daughter and countless women suffering at the hand of an extreme narcissist.’ i believe i have done this now. i thank christie for forgiving me and i wish her only the best. newline_char newline_char “i would like to move on with my life now, quietly and privately. peter and i have filed for divorce. i am putting this behind me.”

once a cheater, always a cheater! newline_char newline_char eight years after his severely bitter split from christie brinkley and their subsequent financial and custody battle, the model’s newline_char newline_char unfaithful ex husband, peter cook, has legally separated from his wife, suzanne shaw— and sources tell the new york post’s page six that his infidelities are to blame. newline_char newline_char photos: cheaters gallery newline_char newline_char “suzanne stood by peter for years, through all his battles with christie, but he lied to her and completely misrepresented himself. she repeatedly caught him cheating,” an insider told the paper. newline_char newline_char shaw, who was wed to cook, 55, for more than six years, left their hamptons home in february with her teenage daughter after filing for separation. newline_char newline_char photos: celebs who have been divorced twice before 40 newline_char newline_char cook’s lawyer, john j. fellin, denies his client cheated. newline_char newline_char “the separation agreement does not mention, in any way, infidelity by mr. cook, and any such allegations to that end are without merit,” he told the post. newline_char newline_char photos: don’t get mad, get everything! inside the 16 most expensive celebrity divorces of all time newline_char newline_char brinkley, 60, and cook are still at each other’s throats years after they split amid allegations he cheated with his 18-year-old assistant, diana bianchi. the national enquirer recently reported that the pair has been battling over custody issues with their 16-year-old daughter, sailor. newline_char newline_char “the sad reality is, almost eight years later, christie is still mired in our divorce and hatred of me which has been irreparably damaging to our children,” cook recently told radaronline.com.

summary: – The second ex-wife of Peter Cook has issued a written apology to his first wife - supermodel Christie Brinkley - for ignoring her warning about the architect's philandering. In her letter, Suzanne Shaw writes that she was wrong to bad-mouth Brinkley and that the model was only trying to protect her children. Shaw also says she regrets her involvement with Cook and that she is now moving on with her life.

summary: – did christie brinkley really think her first husband was going to cheat on her? well, at least, that's the impression given by her ex-wife's apology to the new york post. "i truly feel it's simply the right thing to do," suzanne shaw writes in the note, which was first reported by the paper. "unfortunately, i fell under peter's spell, but now that the reality of who he is has been revealed, i regret my involvement." shaw added that she has spoken to brinkley about the situation, and that she "apologizes for the hurt and pain that i have caused her." it's not the first time shaw has apologized to brinkley. in 2012, she publicly blamed her husband for the divorce, and he fired back at her in court. "when you find out he's been cheating on you, i'll be here for you," she said. "come up with a new line!" shaw barked back. it turned out that brinkley was right. and shaw split with cook this year, accusing him of cheating.

summary: – first christie brinkley, then suzanne shaw, has issued a written apology for ignoring her warning about her ex-husband's philandering, the new york post reports. "i have talked recently and i have privately apologized to her, but, given the public nature of their divorce and custody battle, i feel a public apology is also appropriate and deserved," shaw writes in a letter obtained by the post. brinkley was " wrongly vilified as being an embittered ex-wife," she writes. "i now believe she had every right to do what she did by taking a public stand; she was only trying to protect her children and have the truth be told." in a 2012 hearing, brinkley tried to warn shaw about cook's infidelity. "when you find out he’s been cheating on you, i’ll be here for you," she said. "come up with a new line!” shaw barked back. it turned out brinkley was right, and shaw split with cook this year. “what i say here is by my own volition. i truly feel it’s simply the right thing to do. i’m deeply sorry for my part in causing christie any unnecessary pain," she writes. “unfortunately, i fell under peter’s spell, but now that the reality of who he is has been revealed, i regret my involvement. christie is a wonderful mother and community member who involves herself in charitable causes and has truly made a contribution to society."

a north carolina couple is suing the producers of love it or list it, saying the show left them with a house that was shoddily constructed. the raleigh news & observer says that deena murphy and timothy sullivan agreed to participate in the hit hgtv series under the guise that they were considering a move to a rental property with their teenage foster children. the problem, according to the suit against big coat tv and aaron fitz construction, was that the show’s principals—designer hilary farr, real estate agent david visentin, and contractor eric eremita—are “actors or television personalities playing a role for the camera,” not people who “played more than a casual role in the actual renovation process.” while this shouldn’t come as a surprise to anyone who’s ever suffered through farr and visentin’s bullshit “no, you are” banter, it’s still mildly disheartening to hear. newline_char newline_char for the episode, which aired in april 2015, murphy and sullivan were asked to deposit $140,000 into a fund with the production company, who would later use that money to pay fitz and other subcontractors. according to the suit, the couple voiced its concerns about fitz, saying it had below-average reviews on angie’s list, but they were ignored. over the course of the renovations, only $85,780.50 was disbursed to fitz, leaving the couple wondering where the rest of their money went. the suit also questions how big coat can operate as a general contractor, a role it’s not licensed for. newline_char newline_char murphy and sullivan are also claiming that love it or list it is even more of a scam than it generally seems, with the couple saying the show never used a licensed architect to develop plans for their house, and that they were never shown houses that were actually for sale in north carolina—or for sale by any licensed north carolina real estate broker. they also say any work done on the show was work that they’d previously made plans for with another company, werx-design build. newline_char newline_char according to the suit, the actual work done on the house was “disastrous,” leaving the home “irreparably damaged.” duct work was left open, leading to vermin entering the house, and the couple complains of “low-grade industrial carpeting, unpainted surfaces, and windows painted shut.” newline_char newline_char as the news & observer summarizes, “big coat’s purported agreement,” the lawsuit contends, ‘admits that it is in the business of television production, not construction. ... the homeowners’ funds essentially pay the cost of creating a stage set for this television series.’” newline_char newline_char maria armstrong, big coat’s ceo and the show’s executive producer, says that the company intends to “vigorously defend what [it] consider[s] false allegations.” newline_char newline_char submit your newswire tips here.

summary: A North Carolina couple is suing the production company for HGTV's "Love It or List It," claiming the show turned their dream home into a nightmare. The lawsuit against Big Coat TV and one of its contractors alleges the couple were "victims of shoddy work and unfair trade practices" that left their floors, windows and other parts of their home damaged. The show's premise is to renovate a family's home while the owners contemplate moving into a new home. In their lawsuit, Murphy and Sullivan describe Big Coat's business model as "skewed." They said they gave the production company $140,000 for renovations, but only about $85,000 went to the contractor. The couple claims the production company used the remaining funds "for the production of its series."

summary: – a north carolina couple is hoping to put a stop to "fixer upper," the hit home renovation show hosted by david visentin and hilary farr. deena murphy and timothy sullivan say the show's business model was "skewed," leaving them "victims of shoddy work and unfair trade practices," the unc reports. the couple is seeking at least $140,000 in damages from big coat tv and one of its contractors, saying the renovations damaged their floors, windows, and other parts of the house. their attorney tells the la times that the couple's motivation is "to make decisions that favor the television show but not the homeowners." big coat says the lawsuit is "in no way supported by any of the facts of the case, and we will be defending ourselves vigorously in this matter," per the entertainment tonight.

summary: – a north carolina couple is trying to pull back the curtains on a popular home renovation reality show. deena murphy and timothy sullivan are suing the production company for hgtv's "love it or list it," claiming the show turned their dream home into a nightmare. the lawsuit against big coat tv and one of its contractors alleges the couple were "victims of shoddy work and unfair trade practices" that left their floors, windows, and other parts of their home damaged. "one of the things they're doing in this lawsuit is kind of blowing the secrecy off of reality tv," an analyst tells today. murphy and sullivan agreed to participate in the show under the guise that they were considering a move to a rental property with their teenage foster children. during the renovations, they say they gave big coat $140,000 for renovations, but only about $85,000 went to the contractor. they claim the remaining funds were used for the production of the show. the show's ceo and executive producer haven't commented on the lawsuit, but they say they believe the claim is "in no way supported by any of the facts of the case," and they will be "vigorously defending ourselves vigorously in this matter."

documents: for members of the deaf community, ordering food or drinks at a drive-thru can be a frustrating, or even impossible, experience. but as one deaf woman recently discovered, starbucks is trying to make this feature accessible for customers with disabilities -- with the help of a little technology. newline_char newline_char on tuesday, 28-year-old rebecca king of st. augustine, florida, uploaded a video to facebook which reveals what happened during her visit to a local starbucks drive-thru. newline_char newline_char the video shows king driving up to the ordering kiosk. a woman’s voice emits from the intercom. newline_char newline_char "hi, welcome to starbucks," the woman says. "what can we get started for you today?" newline_char newline_char king does not respond and waits in her seat. a few moments later, a starbucks barista appears on a monitor. newline_char newline_char king begins to communicate with the woman using sign language, and the barista signs right back. newline_char newline_char "starbucks! this is what i’m talking about!" king wrote in her facebook post, which has been watched more than 4.9 million times to date. "share it away! we can change the world!"

a new technology is getting a lot of attention — and for good reason — at the brand-new starbucks by the outlet malls in st. johns county. newline_char newline_char a video posted on facebook shows a customer named rebecca king using sign language for an order -- and barista, katie wyble, quickly signs back. newline_char newline_char wyble says she's had a "passion for sign language since i first saw a teacher use it when i was in preschool." wyble used a two-way video screen to see king, and the duo quickly completed an order for two coffees. newline_char newline_char king's video of the encounter went viral overnight. the video was just posted tuesday, and it has more than 1 million views and over 65,000 shares. newline_char newline_char “share it away," king said on facebook. "we can change the world!” newline_char newline_char “i think more people need to know about what we’re doing because it moves customer service to a whole new level,” wyble said. “i hope it helps make more people aware of what they can to do serve others in their communities.” newline_char newline_char st. augustine is known to have a large deaf and blind community. action news jax spoke to professor tiri fellows, who is deaf and teaches american sign language. she had a translator tell us what she thought about this technology. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char “i think it's awesome because it gives the deaf opportunity to order in a different way through the window,” dr. fellows said. newline_char newline_char dr. fellows says going through a drive-thru without a device like this is such a hassle for the deaf or hearing impaired. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char she says its about time someone created this device to help them. newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char “it’s about time,” dr. fellows said. “my friends from arizona saw that on facebook, illinois texas — they all reposted that video.” newline_char newline_char newline_char newline_char dr. fellows hopes the video continues to spread on social media so other businesses will want to get the technology as well.

summary: – when it comes to making life easier for people with disabilities, one fast-food chain has found a way to make things a little easier: sign language. starbucks has installed a sign-language interpreter at one of its drive-thrus in st. augustine, florida, reports abc news. the company says the device, which is hidden in a cup holder, will enable deaf and hard-of-hearing customers to order through the drive-thru without having to use a sign interpreter. a video of the encounter, posted by rebecca king on facebook, has gone viral, with more than 1 million views and 65,000 shares as of friday. the video shows a woman's voice emitting from the intercom, and a barista appearing on a monitor. soon, a sign-language interpreter appears on screen, and the duo quickly complete an order. the company says it plans to roll out the feature at other drive-thrus across the country. "i think more people need to know about what we're doing because it moves customer service to a whole new level," wyble says. "i hope it makes people aware of what they can do."

summary: – if you're a deaf or hearing impaired customer, ordering food or drinks at a drive-thru can be a frustrating, or even impossible, experience. one deaf woman recently discovered, however, a new feature accessible for customers with disabilities -- with the help of a little technology. a video posted on facebook shows a customer named rebecca king using sign language for an order, and the barista, katie wyble, quickly signs back. king's video, which was posted tuesday, has been watched more than 4.9 million times to date. wyble says she's had a "passion for sign language since i first saw a teacher use it when i was in preschool." wyble used a two-way video screen to see king, and the duo quickly completed an order for two coffees. the video went viral overnight. "share it away! we can change the world!" king says on facebook. “i think more people need to know about what we’re doing because it moves customer service to a whole new level,” wyble says. “i hope it helps make more people aware of what they can to do serve others in their communities.” action news jax spoke to professor tiri fellows, who is deaf and teaches american sign language. she had a translator tell us what she thought about this technology. “i think it's awesome because it gives the deaf opportunity to order in a different way through the window," she said.

newline_char newline_char book says hillary talks to dead newline_char newline_char first lady acknowledged newline_char newline_char 'imaginary' chats. newline_char newline_char june 22, 1996 newline_char newline_char web posted at: 11:55 p.m. edt newline_char newline_char washington (cnn) -- first lady hillary rodham clinton held imaginary conversations with eleanor roosevelt and mahatma gandhi as a therapeutic release, according to a new book written by bob woodward, says a report in sunday's edition of the chicago sun-times. newline_char newline_char the first lady declined a personal adviser's suggestion that she address jesus christ, however, because it would be "too personal," according to woodward's book, "the choice." newline_char newline_char the book, which is still to be published, takes a behind-the-scenes look at the clintons, as well as bob and elizabeth dole. newline_char newline_char woodward says the adviser was jean houston, co-director of the foundation for mind research, which he describes as a group that studies the psychic experience and altered and expanded consciousness. newline_char newline_char the book portrays houston as an influential adviser who urged mrs. clinton to write her book, "it takes a village and other lessons children teach us," and in the process "virtually moved into the white house" for days at a time to help with revisions, the sun-times reported. newline_char newline_char woodward suggests the white house hoped to keep mrs. clinton's relationship with houston and her talks with the dead a secret. newline_char newline_char "most people in the white house did not know about hillary's sessions with houston. ... to some of the few who did, the meetings could trigger politically damaging comparisons to nancy reagan's use of astrology," woodward wrote. newline_char newline_char mrs. clinton's spokeswoman, lisa caputo, is quoted in the sun-times as saying the first lady's interest in houston is no secret. newline_char newline_char woodward says anthropologist mary catherine bateson, daughter of famed anthropologist margaret mead, joined her in sessions of imaginary conversations. newline_char newline_char woodward is an assistant managing editor at the washington post. as a reporter, he helped break the watergate scandal with carl bernstein. newline_char newline_char mrs. clinton herself wrote about her imaginary conversations with eleanor roosevelt in her june 10 column. she said she talked to roosevelt about the role of a first lady. newline_char newline_char "she usually responds by telling me to buck up, or at least to grow skin as thick as a rhinoceros," mrs. clinton wrote. newline_char newline_char in the column, she described houston as an expert on philosophy and mythology. "(houston) has shared her views with me on everything from the ancient greeks to the lives of women and children on bangladesh," she wrote. newline_char newline_char mrs. clinton also acknowledged her relationship with bateson. newline_char newline_char "she and i have spent hours discussing the ways in which women in different societies attempt to fulfill their responsibilities to their families, jobs and communities," mrs. clinton wrote. newline_char newline_char related stories:

summary: – first lady hillary clinton held imaginary conversations with eleanor roosevelt and mahatma gandhi as a therapeutic release, a new book says. the first lady declined a personal adviser's suggestion that she address jesus christ, however, because it would be "too personal," according to bob woodward's book, "the choice," which is still to be published. woodward says the adviser was jean houston, co-director of the foundation for mind research, which studies the psychic experience and altered and expanded consciousness. the book portrays the clintons as an influential adviser who urged mrs. clinton to write her book, "it takes a village and other lessons children teach us," and in the process "virtually moved into the white house" for days at a time to help with revisions, the sun-times reports. woodward suggests that hillary clinton did not know about the existence of the white house until after she left it.

release, according to a new book written by bob woodward, says a report in sunday's edition of the chicago sun-times. newline_char newline_char the first lady declined a personal adviser's suggestion that she address jesus christ, however, because it would be "too personal," according to woodward's book, "the choice." newline_char newline_char the book, which is still to be published, takes a behind-the-scenes look at the clintons, as well as bob and elizabeth dole. newline_char newline_char woodward says the adviser was jean houston, co-director of the foundation for mind research, which he describes as a group that studies the psychic experience and altered and expanded consciousness. newline_char newline_char the book portrays houston as an influential adviser who urged mrs. clinton to write her book, "it takes a village and other lessons children teach us," and in the process "virtually moved into the white house" for days at a time to help with revisions, the sun-times reported. newline_char newline_char woodward suggests the white house hoped to keep mrs. clinton's relationship with houston and her talks with the dead a secret. newline_char newline_char "most people in the white house did not know about hillary's sessions with houston. ... to some of the few who did, the meetings could trigger politically damaging comparisons to nancy reagan's use of astrology," woodward wrote. newline_char newline_char mrs. clinton's spokeswoman, lisa caputo, is quoted in the sun-times as saying the first lady's interest in houston is no secret. newline_char newline_char woodward says anthropologist mary catherine bateson, daughter of famed anthropologist margaret mead, joined her in sessions of imaginary conversations. newline_char newline_char woodward is an assistant managing editor at the washington post. as a reporter, he helped break the watergate scandal with carl bernstein. newline_char newline_char mrs. clinton herself wrote about her imaginary conversations with eleanor roosevelt in her june 10 column. she said she talked to roosevelt about the role of a first lady. newline_char newline_char "she usually responds by telling me to buck up, or at least to grow skin as thick as a rhinoceros," mrs. clinton wrote. newline_char newline_char in the column, she described houston as an expert on philosophy and mythology. "(houston) has shared her views with me on everything from the ancient greeks to the lives of women and children on bangladesh," she wrote. newline_char newline_char mrs. clinton also acknowledged her relationship with bateson. newline_char newline_char "she and i have spent hours discussing the ways in which women in different societies attempt to fulfill their responsibilities to their families, jobs and communities," mrs. clinton wrote. newline_char newline_char related stories: ||||| meadville, pa (16335) newline_char newline_char today newline_char newline_char cloudy with snow showers becoming a steady accumulating snow later on. low 19f. winds s at 10 to 20 mph. chance of snow 90%. snow accumulating 1 to 3 inches.. newline_char newline_char tonight newline_char newline_char cloudy with snow showers becoming a steady accumulating snow later on. low 19f. winds s at 10 to 20 mph. chance of snow 90%. snow accumulating 1 to 3 inches. ||||| we've detected that javascript is disabled in your browser. would you like to proceed to legacy twitter? newline_char newline_char yes |||||
summary: – first lady hillary rodham clinton held imaginary conversations with eleanor roosevelt and mahatma gandhi as a therapeutic release, according to a new book written by bob woodward, reports the chicago sun-times. the book, which is still to be published, takes a behind-the-scenes look at the clintons, as well as bob and elizabeth dole. woodward says the adviser was jean houston, co-director of the foundation for mind research, which he describes as a group that studies the psychic experience and altered and expanded consciousness. the book portrays houston as an influential adviser who urged mrs. clinton to write her book, "it takes a village and other lessons children teach us," and in the process "virtually moved into the white house" for days at a time to help with revisions, the sun-times reports. woodward suggests the white house hoped to keep mrs. clinton's relationship with houston a secret. "most people in the white house did not know about hillary's sessions with houston. ... to some of the few who did, the meetings could trigger politically damaging comparisons to nancy reagan's use of astrology," woodward writes. mrs. clinton herself wrote about her imaginary conversations with roosevelt in her june 10 column. she said she talked to roosevelt about the role of a first lady. "she usually responds by telling me to buck up, or at least to grow skin as thick as a rhinoceros," mrs. clinton wrote.

documents: listen to article 2:32 share this article facebook twitter linkedin email newline_char newline_char steve wynn’s plan to sell a pair of picasso paintings for a high estimate of $105 million was derailed after the more expensive of the two was damaged friday -- a dozen years after the billionaire collector and erstwhile casino magnate put his elbow through another masterpiece by the artist. newline_char newline_char picasso’s 1943 self-portrait "le marin" source: christie’s newline_char newline_char “le marin,” a 1943 self-portrait, was damaged friday “during the final stages of preparation” for auction tuesday and pulled from the block, christie’s said in a statement. it declined to comment on the nature or extent of the damage. lin wood, a spokesman for wynn, declined to comment. newline_char newline_char the painting, which measures a little more than 4-by-2 1/2 feet and estimated at $70 million, was one of three wynn consigned to christie’s for sale this week for a total of as much as $135 million, according to the auction house’s estimates. on monday, picasso’s 1964 portrait of a woman with a cat, “femme au chat assise dans un fauteuil,” was also pulled from the auction by mutual agreement with the seller, christie’s said. that piece, also owned by wynn, is estimated at $25 million to $35 million. newline_char newline_char wynn, who suffers from a disease that affects his peripheral vision, accidentally struck his picasso “le reve” with his right elbow in 2006 while showing it to friends in his las vegas office, leaving a hole the size of a silver dollar. the painting had been worth $139 million before that, according to wynn’s lawsuit against the insurer, lloyd’s of london. a restorer said the repaired painting was worth $85 million, according to the lawsuit. hedge fund titan steve cohen bought it from wynn in 2013 for $155 million. newline_char newline_char “femme au chat assise dans un fauteuil” photographer: katya kazakina/bloomberg newline_char newline_char both withdrawn paintings had been guaranteed by christie’s and backed by third-party guarantees. the withdrawal of a work from sale removes any guarantee made for the transaction, christie’s said, adding that its consignment contracts “have insurance provisions to cover damage and other contingencies.” newline_char newline_char wynn resigned as chief executive officer of wynn resorts ltd. in february amid sexual-misconduct allegations. he has denied wrongdoing. newline_char newline_char the other wynn lot at christie’s is andy warhol’s 1963 “double elvis [ferus type],” which will be offered as planned at the postwar and contemporary evening sale on may 17, christie’s said. estimated at more than $30 million, it depicts elvis presley dressed as a cowboy and shooting from the hip. newline_char newline_char the painting last appeared at auction in 2012 when it fetched $37 million at sotheby’s. at the time it was bought by the mugrabi family, which owns one of the world’s largest private warhol collections. newline_char newline_char — with assistance by peter jeffrey

summary: – billionaire casino magnate steve wynn's plan to sell two picasso paintings at auction for a total of $105 million was derailed after the more expensive of the two was damaged. – the painting, "le marin," was damaged during the final stages of preparation for the auction and has been pulled from the sale. – wynn is no stranger to accidentally damaging priceless works of art; in 2006, he put his elbow through another picasso painting, "le reve."

summary: – one of steve wynn's prized postwar and contemporary art pieces has been pulled from auction after it was discovered that one of the artist's self-portraits had been damaged. "le marin," a 1943 self-portrait, was damaged friday "during the final stages of preparation" for sale at christie's in los angeles, the auction house announced monday. it is now estimated at $70 million to $80 million, the difference between what the house had expected it to fetch and what it actually sold. the other wynn lot, a 1964 portrait of a woman with a cat, was pulled from the sale monday because of "third-party concerns regarding the condition of the painting," the auction house said in a statement.

summary: – billionaire steve wynn’s plan to sell a pair of picasso paintings for a high estimate of $105 million was derailed after the more expensive of the two was damaged friday, the guardian reports. the 1943 self-portrait, a 1943 self-portrait, was damaged “during the final stages of preparation” for auction tuesday and pulled from the block, christie's said in a statement. it declined to comment on the nature or extent of the damage. wynn, who suffers from a disease that affects his peripheral vision, accidentally struck his picasso “le reve” with his right elbow in 2006 while showing it to friends in his las vegas office, leaving a hole the size of a silver dollar. the painting is now estimated at $85 million. another picasso painting, “femme au chat assise dans un fauteuil,” was pulled from the auction monday by mutual agreement with the seller; that piece, also owned by wynn, is estimated at $25 million to $35 million. the withdrawn paintings had been guaranteed by christie’s and backed by third-party guarantees. the withdrawal of a work from sale removes any guarantee made for the transaction, christie’s said, adding that its consignment contracts “have insurance provisions to cover damage and other contingencies.” wynn resigned as chief executive officer of wynn resorts ltd. in february amid sexual-misconduct allegations. he has denied wrongdoing.

rome — if the paragon of all christmas trees is the one in front of the rockefeller center in new york — first erected, mind you, by an italian in 1931 — the prize for most pitiful must go to the one that stands in rome’s piazza venezia this year. just days after it was put up, it began to gray and shed its needles, and soon it had become nearly see-through. the tree cuts so sad and forlorn a figure that it has been nicknamed spelacchio, or mangy. newline_char newline_char spelacchio arrived in rome early this month from the trentino region, near italy’s border with austria, and what with transport expenses and decorations, the 70-foot fir is estimated to have cost italian taxpayers 48,000 euros, or $57,000. it’s not clear what has ailed it. maybe spelacchio was unsettled by the trip; perhaps it was ill on departure. by way of explanation, antimo palumbo, a tree historian who was standing by spelacchio’s side on friday morning, pointed at the concrete all over its roots. “you see that?” he told me. “they decided to pour the concrete to keep it steady, but that killed it instead.” newline_char newline_char there isn’t enough time, money or political will to replace the tree, and so spelacchio the mangy will stay in piazza venezia through the holidays, and for many locals it has already become a metaphor for what’s wrong with the city, and the country. newline_char newline_char traffic in rome is chronically congested, public transport is inefficient, trash collection is slow and sporadic. early hopes about virginia raggi, who was elected mayor last year on an anti-establishment agenda, promptly faded amid familiar allegations of corruption and nepotism.
